php-smart-files.submenus.main.label: Create PHP File
php-smart-files.config.useStrictTypeInTe: Determines whether `declare(strict_types=1);` is included in generated files.
php-smart-files.config.useFallbackNamesp: Determines whether to use a fallback namespace when no namespace could be resolved via composer.json. When enabled, builds a namespace based on the file's relative path from the workspace directory, starting with the fallback namespace as prefix. When disabled, no namespace will be added.
php-smart-files.config.fallbackNamespace: Defines the base namespace prefix to use when fallback namespace is enabled. The complete namespace will be constructed by combining this prefix with the file's directory structure (e.g., 'App' + '\SubDirectory\AnotherDirectory' becomes 'App\SubDirectory\AnotherDirectory').
The namespace must be a valid PHP namespace according to PSR-4 (e.g. 'App', 'Vendor\Service'). Each segment must start with an uppercase letter.
php-smart-files.config.refactorNamespace: Determines whether, after a file is moved, the namespace in the file and its references should be refactored.

Determines whether, after a file is renamed, class names or other declaration identifiers should be adapted to the new filename. This includes updating all internal references (like MyClass::SOME_STATIC), 'use' statements and all external references in other files.
Determines whether, after a directory is moved or renamed, the namespaces in all files within this directory and their references should be refactored.
Specifies directories to exclude during namespace refactoring. (Note: Entries are expected in Glob pattern format, e.g., `/vendor/**`, `var/cache/**`, or `**/temp/**`.)
